thread.title: Man charged with armed robbery after Valdosta convenience store incident
thread.title_full: Man charged with armed robbery after Valdosta convenience store incident

author: Ty Grant
title: Man charged with armed robbery after Valdosta convenience store incident
text:
VALDOSTA, Ga. (WALB) - A man has been arrested and is facing several charges, following an incident that took place at a convenience store in Valdosta.
According to the Valdosta Police Department (VPD), on Monday, April 22 at around 9:40 p.m. officers responded to the Shell Gas Station on the 900 block of Baytree Road. After receiving a call from the store clerk and a witness that a man had come into the store, produced a firearm, then proceeded to take money and items from the store.
After the surveillance video was reviewed, detectives identified Na’quwan Fryson, 19, as the person who entered the store with a firearm and committed the robbery.
Warrants for Fryson were obtained for armed robbery, aggravated assault and possession of a firearm during the commission of a felony.
On Friday, April 26 at around 5 a.m., VPD responded to the area of the 100 block of East Hill Avenue after receiving a call to report suspicious activity in a parking lot. When officers arrived in the area, Fryson was seen and taken into custody for the arrest warrant.
According to the report, Fryson was found with a weapon that was reported stolen earlier in 2024.
“This is incredible teamwork by our department,” Valdosta Police Chief Leslie Manahan said. “From the quick identification of the offender by detectives, all the way to the successful apprehension of him, along with the recovery of a firearm. I am proud of the effort by our entire department.”
This case is still under investigation and further charges are pending.
If anyone has any information on this case, police are asking that you contact the Valdosta Police Department Bureau of Investigative Services at (229) 293-3145, the crime tip line at (229) 293-3091 or file a tip online at www.valdostacity.com/police-department.
